summary: Renewed tariff fears have led to a selloff in bonds and most stocks. Gold and silver, energy and small-caps are faring better.

title: Indian stock market unlikely to see a pre-Budget rally; don't expect any large tax relief: Atul Parakh, Bigul
summary: We do not expect major income tax cuts or big changes in GST in this budget, as the government remains focused on controlling the fiscal deficit, says Atul Parakh, CEO of Bigul.

title: KRM Ayurveda IPO Day 1: Latest GMP, subscription status, listing date & other details about  ₹77.5 crore issue
summary: KRM Ayurveda IPO, opened on January 21, saw a subscription of 0.66 times by 01:30 PM. The price band is set between  ₹128-135, aiming to raise  ₹77.5 crore. The allotment date is January 27, with shares listing on NSE SME scheduled for January 22.

title: IPO Watch: Blackstone considers $550 million PGP Glass IPO, says report
summary: Blackstone Inc. is considering an initial public offering for Indian glass packaging maker PGP Glass Pvt. in Mumbai that could raise as much as $500 million, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Narmadesh Brass Industries SME IPO listing: Shares hit lower circuit after listing at a 4% discount to the issue price
summary: Narmadesh Brass Industries IPO listing:  Narmadesh Brass Industries opened at  ₹495, 3.9% lower than the issue price of  ₹515. Soon after the listing, the stock plunged further to hit its 5% lower circuit of  ₹470.25.

title: Trent to Tata Chemicals: Five Tata group stocks hit fresh 1-year lows as market sell-off extends to third day
summary: Tata Group stocks, including Tata Chemicals and Trent, hit one-year lows amid a deepening sell-off in the Indian stock market, driven by global trade tensions and investor caution. Tata Chemicals dropped 4.2% to  ₹700, while Trent fell nearly 4% to  ₹3,736.

title: InvAscent-backed Ankura Hospitals may raise  ₹400-500 crore, appoints banker
summary: The development comes less than a year after Ankura Hospitals raised funds to expand its operations, and at a time when investor interest in the mother and child care market has been steadily rising

title: N Chandrasekaran, Sunil Mittal: 7 top Indian business leaders to speak with Trump at Davos today, says report
summary: The select group of business leaders who Trump is set to meet at Davos includes at least seven Indian industry stalwarts, including Tata Sons' N Chandrasekaran and Bharti Enterprises' Sunil Mittal, as per a new report.

title: How can I allocate my investments to ensure my retirement savings don't run out?
summary: Investing the entire corpus in a fixed deposit might not work out in the long run, so a more nuanced approach and diversified approach is required.

title: European shares extend selloff on trade jitters
summary: European shares dipped on Wednesday, deepening a selloff sparked by renewed trade tensions linked ‌to Greenland, ‌which overpowered the impact of upbeat corporate updates.

title: Midcap Meltdown: 14 stocks crash up to 50% in just 3 months. Is your portfolio at risk?
summary: Midcaps are under heavy pressure as 14 stocks plunge 20–50% in just three months, signalling a sharp sentiment shift beneath the market’s calm surface.

title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala on why asset allocation matters more than stock picking
summary: According to Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, nearly 60% of an investor’s long-term returns come from getting asset allocation right, while only 40% depend on selecting the right individual assets.

title: Govt must prioritise fiscal prudence in Budget, even if it means curbing revenue spend: Nitin Agarwal of InCred Money
summary: Nitin Agarwal, CEO of InCred Money, emphasises the need for fiscal prudence in India's upcoming budget. His insights highlight the shifting landscape of investment strategies and the evolving role of gold as a strategic asset.

title: Tata Communications Q3 Results: Net profit jumps 55% YoY to  ₹364 crore, revenue rises 7%
summary: Tata Communications reported a consolidated net profit of  ₹364 crore for the December quarter, a 54% increase year-on-year. Sequentially, profit rose 99% from  ₹183.21 crore in the previous quarter, with revenue from operations at  ₹6,189 crore, up 6.74%.

title: Aritas Vinyl allotment to be finalised today: Step-by-step guide to check your allotment status
summary: Aritas Vinyl IPO allotment is set for today, January 21. The  ₹37.52 crore IPO was oversubscribed 2.21 times, with retail investors oversubscribing 2.88 times. Refunds begin January 22 for those not allotted shares, which will be credited the same day. Listing on BSE SME is expected January 23.

title: Budget 2026: Big bang reforms unlikely; infra push, structural measures to get focus amid global headwinds: PL Capital
summary: Budget 2026: Big bang announcements are unlikely in the upcoming Budget 2026-2027, following last year’s sweeping tax reforms. Instead, the government is expected to focus on sustaining growth through incremental reforms and targeted capital expenditure, expects PL Capital.

title: Why AU Small Finance Bank's profit surge isn't just about growth
summary: Lower provisions, improved asset quality, and a rebound in unsecured lending drove AU Small Finance Bank’s Q3 profit growth. But rising operating costs and a competitive deposit market could cap upside going forward.

title: Sebi, Amfi in talks on cutting KYC, depository charges with an eye on mutual fund profitability
summary: The discussions come a month after Sebi cut brokerage and transaction costs for mutual funds and tightened the overall total expense ratio (TER) framework.

title: Simplified GST registration leaves MSMEs trapped if turnover rises
summary: The GST portal blocks small businesses whenever their output tax exceeds the  ₹2.5 lakh threshold. They can't even register as a regular business without three GST returns.

title: A Word a Day to Budget 2026 - Fiscal deficit: What the government needs to borrow, and how it impacts the stock market
summary: In this mini series in the 10-day run-up to Budget 2026, we will every day take up and explain one word/term that is used in the budget. It will help you as investors to better understand the document that is the primary instrument through which the government's fiscal policy is articulated and implemented. This is important, as the decisions announced in the budget impact every part of the economy, including the stock market. Our word/term for the day is: Fiscal deficit. Just this number moving by a few basis points here or there will make the Nifty or Sensex move up or down strongly.

title: ‘Pray that stocks don’t fall’: Nithin Kamath warns Rs 1.1 lakh crore margin trading boom has worrying risks
summary: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has warned that the rapid rise in margin trading facilities to over Rs 1.1 lakh crore poses structural risks to Indian equities, cautioning that leveraged positions could worsen market stress during a sharp correction.

title: Rekha Jhunjhunwala ups promoter stake by 1,253 bps to 15.57% in Star Health in December quarter
summary: Rekha Jhunjhunwala increased her promoter stake in Star Health to 15.57% in the December quarter amid persistent stock underperformance. The move comes as the insurer reported weaker profitability and continued to trade below key moving averages.

title: Hero MotoCorp board to meet on this date to consider Q3 results. Check details
summary: Hero MotoCorp board to meet on this date to consider Q3 results. Check details

title: SRF expects better Q4 for specialty chemicals biz. But is that enough?
summary: For SRF, the benefits of additional capacity will accrue gradually, and near-term hinges on the specialty chemicals business.

title: Top Gainers & Losers on Jan 21: Kalyan Jewellers, SRF, Paytm, Cyient, Tata Chemicals, Angel One among top losers
summary: The Indian stock market fell for the third consecutive day on January 21, with the Nifty down 0.3% and Sensex down 0.25%. Concerns over US tariff threats and disappointing corporate earnings contributed to the declines, alongside significant foreign portfolio investor sell-offs.

title: Sensex falls 300 points; nearly 900 stocks hit 52-week lows on BSE— 10 key highlights from Indian stock market today
summary: The Sensex fell 271 points, or 0.33%, to end at 81,909.63, while the Nifty 50 settled at 25,157.50, down 75 points, or 0.30%. The BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices lost 1% and 0.80%, respectively.

title: Budget 2026: Seen neutral from market lens; Nuvama prefers telecom, internet, IT
summary: Budget 2026, presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on February 1, is anticipated to support modest growth without favoring specific sectors. Increased defense spending and railway capital expenditures are expected, while Nuvama adopts a cautious investment approach.

title: Kapur family feud deepens as Rani Kapur moves Delhi HC to scrap Sona Comstar trust
summary: Rani Kapur has alleged the trust was created through fraud to strip her of assets and control of the Sona Group, escalating the legal battle over Sunjay Kapur’s estate.

title: Jio valuation may jump to $190 billion by 2028, says CLSA, raises RIL target price to Rs 1,800
summary: CLSA expects Jio Platforms’ valuation to surge toward $190 billion by 2028, driven by a potential IPO, accelerating free cash flow, 5G monetisation and subscriber growth, lifting Reliance Industries’ target price despite more cautious assumptions for retail and new energy.

title: Eternal Q3 Results: Profit surges 73% YoY to  ₹102 crore; revenue jumps 3-fold
summary: In terms of financial performance, Eternal's net profit surged 73% year-on-year (YoY) to  ₹102 crore from  ₹59 crore a year-ago.

title: Eternal Q3 results: Consolidated profit jumps 73% to  ₹102 crore; quick commerce margin turns green— 5 key highlights
summary: Eternal Q3 results: Zomato parent Eternal on Wednesday, January 21, reported a 72.88% year-on-year (YoY) jump in its consolidated profit to  ₹102 crore for Q3FY26. Consolidated revenue from operations for the quarter under review more than tripled to  ₹16,315 crore.

title: Why Deepinder Goel quit as Eternal CEO and what's next for the company and him? He explains in letter to shareholders
summary: Why Deepinder Goel quit as Eternal CEO and what next for the company and him? He explains in letter to shareholders

title: IndiaMART to step up tech investments over two years after strong Q3: CEO Dinesh Agarwal
summary: IndiaMART’s long-term growth strategy now involves prioritising AI-driven tools to enhance operational efficiency and supplier retention. The company is also exploring quick-commerce partnerships and stepping up efforts to deepen its footprint in southern India even as competition revs up.

title: Deepinder Goyal to step down as Eternal CEO, Blinkit's Albinder Singh Dhindsa to take charge
summary: Eternal's CEO Deepinder Goyal resigns, effective February 1, 2026. The Board has recommended him for the position of Vice Chairman, while Albinder Singh Dhindsa will take over as CEO. The announcement was made alongside the financial results for the quarter ending 31, 2025.

title: Who is Ganesh Lakshminarayanan? Tata Communications appoints industry veteran as new MD & CEO
summary: Tata Communications appointed industry veteran Ganesh Lakshminarayanan as the company's new MD and CEO. Here's what you need to know about the appointment and the veteran's decades-long career.

title: Vedanta’s Rs 2,500 crore ESOP windfall turns factory floors into shareholder ranks
summary: Vedanta has created one of India’s widest employee-wealth programmes, generating Rs 2,500 crore in benefits over five years through ultra-low-priced ESOPs. Its latest Rs 500 crore grant brings 1,200 employees—many freshers—into the shareholder fold. With 40% workforce coverage.

title: Union Budget FY27: These 6 calls could end the fiscal drag, Nuvama says
summary: India’s economy appears to be bottoming out, but Nuvama warns FY27 Budget support may be modest. While fiscal consolidation could pause and capex rise, limited stimulus and global headwinds may restrain earnings recovery and keep markets defensively positioned.

title: Aditya Birla Capital dips after hitting fresh record earlier in January 2026; buy the dip or book profits?
summary: Aditya Birla Capital slipped after hitting record highs earlier in January 2026. Analysts say the stock’s broader uptrend remains intact, with technical indicators suggesting buy-on-dips opportunities for short-term traders targeting Rs 388, despite near-term consolidation pressures.

title: Insurance firms boost stakes in 12 largecap stocks in Q3FY26
summary: Insurance companies raised their stakes in 12 NSE largecap stocks during the December 2025 quarter, signalling growing confidence in select equities. The increase in holdings, tracked via StocksEdge data, reflects insurers’ strategic allocation towards fundamentally strong companies amid evolving market conditions.

title: HPCL Q3 Results: Maharatna PSU's net profit jumps 58% to  ₹4,011 crore; revenue rises 4.6% YoY — Details here
summary: HPCL Q3 Results: Maharatna PSU's net profit jumps 58% to  ₹4,011 crore; revenue rises 4.6% YoY — Details here

title: Dr Reddy's Labs Q3 Results: Profit dips 14% YoY to  ₹1210 crore; revenue grows 4%
summary: The pharma major, part of the Nifty 50 index, said its net profit stood at  ₹1209.8 crore in Q3 FY26 as against  ₹1413.3 crore in the same period a year ago.

title: New lift standards for PwDs to force redesigns for India’s property, infrastructure developers
summary: New elevator standards in India will enhance accessibility for people with disabilities, aligning with the Accessible India campaign. The regulations will standardize lift designs and safety features, improving mobility for the 26.8 million people with disabilities.

title: Watch out! Gold, silver on MCX, ETFs trading at premium to international rates
summary: Gold and silver in India are trading at unusually high premiums over global prices as traders price in fears of a customs duty hike in the Union Budget, triggering sharp MCX, ETF gains and arbitrage distortions despite a bullish long-term outlook.

title: ITC, Siemens Energy India and 8 other stocks hit 52-week lows; slip up to 20% in a month
summary: Ten large-cap stocks, including ITC and Siemens Energy India, hit fresh 52-week lows as market weakness dragged several names down up to 20% over the past month.

title: Rupee slumps to record low on global jitters, outlook remains fragile
summary: The domestic currency logged its steepest intraday fall in almost two months.

title: Intel results to spotlight turnaround efforts as AI data centers boost chip demand
summary: CEO Lip-Bu Tan has overhauled Intel’s chipmaking operations and tightened what he said was a bloated management structure

title: 5 things to know about Blinkit's Albinder Singh Dhindsa, who will replace Deepinder Goyal as Eternal CEO
summary: Deepinder Goyal says Blinkit CEO Albinder Singh Dhindsa has the DNA of a battle-hardened founder, and his ability to execute far exceeds his.&nbsp;

title: Berkshire prepares to exit 28% stake in Kraft Heinz as new CEO aims to move on from rare Buffett gaffe
summary: The move underscores Greg Abel's willingness to look past a deal that has long stood out as a rare blemish in Buffett's otherwise storied record.
